result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Cases 22CF103 and 22TR303 called together.  Defendant Richard Irving Boatman Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard Lance Jones Sr. appeared by video for Richard Irving Boatman Jr.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appeared by video for Richard Irving Boatman Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def appearing from Barron County Jail.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney Jones updates the Court: no resolution reached; will have expert for potential NGI plea.  Discussion of trial length.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:42 AM Called 22CF103 and 22TR303 for STC.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard Irving Boatman Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard Lance Jones Sr. appeared by video for Richard Irving Boatman Jr.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Richard Irving Boatman Jr.  Attny Jones updates the court, has some materials and additional questions but will be up here the week of Aug 29 to see def. Transcript of Preliminary Hearing on May 20, 2022

3:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard Irving Boatman Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard Lance Jones Sr. appeared by video for Richard Irving Boatman Jr.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Richard Irving Boatman Jr. Case on for bond modification hearing on defense's motion.  Atty Pollak defers to atty Jones for additional argument.  Atty Jones argues to reduce bond to $4k cash.  State opposes reduction of bond, argues.  State wishes to read def's letters to victim; discussion; ADA reads letters to victims.  Atty Jones responds.  Court not accepting letters as admissions at this time.  Atty Pollak enters additional argument. Court denies the bond modification request.  Def wants to make a statement.  Bond continues.
Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:11 AM Cases 22CF103 and 22TR303 called together.  Defendant Richard Irving Boatman in court with attorneys Gabriel Andres Pollak and Richard Jones Sr.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF103 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Detective Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Jones crosses.  DA redirects.  State rests, asks for bindover.  Defense objects to bindover, without argument.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information, which deviates from complaint (provides basis for corrections to charges).  Defense is aware of the deviations and proceed to arraignment.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Jones requests 30 days beyond receiving discovery (45 days).  Court extends time to file motions to next STC date.  Court will allow Atty Jones to appear to STCs by video.  Case proceeds to bond motion hearing, atty Pollak enters supplemental argument to motion.  State argues against bond modification, if modified, asks for additional conditions- no weapons, have law enforcement clear the home of any weapons, no contact w/victims, no leaving state without prior authorization, absolute sobriety, curfew, no use/possession of substances or paraphernalia, regular check-ins with law enforcement.  Atty Jones does not object to the proposed conditions.  Court takes judicial notice of cases involving def's mother.  Court denies the bond modification.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:18 PM Cases 22CF103 and 22TR303 called together.  Defendant, Richard Irving Boatman, appeared with Attorneys Gabriel Andres Pollak and Richard Jones Sr (by video).  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody.  Def by video.  Case 22CF103 on for initial appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to misdemeanors and to the TR matter.  WTLPH up to May 20th.  Atty Pollak wants to be heard on bond, filed motion, Court will hear it at prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
